intro: Dimeria hohenackeri subsp. kodaguensis, commonly known as the Kodagu dimeria, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments. The plant features small, clustered flowers with five petals, often in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are usually ovate and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
